      Static factory constructor to simplify creation of new PathogenicityScore objects.

    • getSource

      PathogenicitySource getSource()
      Returns:
      the PathogenicitySource the score was derived from
      Since:
      7.0.0

    • getScore

      float getScore()
      A score in the range of 0-1 where 0 is considered benign and 1 to be pathogenic. The precise nature of the score should be considered on the bases of the source as not all scores will scale in an equivalent way. In cases where the natural range of a score is not 0-1 it is required that the implementation handles the scaling.
      Returns:
      a 0-1 scaled score for this object

    • getRawScore

      float getRawScore()
      In cases such as SIFT or CADD the raw scores as contained in that data source require scaling in order to fit the 0-1 scale used in exomiser. In these cases the result of getScore and getRawScore will not be equal.
      Returns:
      the raw score for this object
      Since:
      12.0.0

    • compareTo

      default int compareTo(PathogenicityScore o)
      For the purposes of this comparator scores are ranked on a scale of 0 to 1 where 0 is considered probably non-pathogenic and 1 probably pathogenic. This comparator will rank the more pathogenic PathogenicityScore higher than a less pathogenic score such that in a sorted list the most pathogenic score will come first. Note: this class has a natural ordering that is inconsistent with equals.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<PathogenicityScore>
      Parameters:
      o - the other score against which to compare this instance
      Since:
      12.0.0

    • compare

      static int compare(PathogenicityScore o1, PathogenicityScore o2)
      For the purposes of this comparator scores are ranked on a scale of 0 to 1 where 0 is considered probably non-pathogenic and 1 probably pathogenic. This comparator will rank the more pathogenic PathogenicityScore higher than a less pathogenic score such that in a sorted list the most pathogenic score will come first. Note: this class has a natural ordering that is inconsistent with equals.
      Returns:
      the value 0 if the scaled score of o1 is numerically equal to the scaled score of o2; the value 1 if o1 is numerically less than o2; and the value -1 if o1 is numerically greater than o2.
      Since:
      12.0.0
